languages.text: {n}Голос проктора гремит обвинением.{/n} "Вот почему арбитры предпочитают немедленно казнить преступников — даруй им жизнь, и как они ей распорядятся? С момента падения в ересь они едва ли имеют право считаться людьми и могут только опускаться еще ниже".

{n}The Proctor's voice booms with denunciation:{/n} "Now you see why Arbitrators prefer to execute criminals immediately — because this is what they will do otherwise with the life they are offered. From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."
languages.original_text: {n}Голос проктора гремит обвинением.{/n} "Вот почему арбитры предпочитают немедленно казнить преступников — даруй им жизнь, и как они ей распорядятся? С момента падения в ересь они едва ли имеют право считаться людьми и могут только опускаться еще ниже".

traits.locale_text: {n}The Proctor's voice booms with denunciation:{/n} "This is why Arbitrators prefer to execute criminals immediately — because this is what they will otherwise do with the life they are offered. From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly deserve the right to be called human — all they can do from that point on is sink deeper."

From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly deserve the right to be called human — all they can do from that point on is sink deeper."

From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."

From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."

From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."

{n}The Proctor's voice booms with denunciation:{/n} "Now you see why Arbitrators prefer to execute criminals immediately — because this is what they will do otherwise with the life they are offered. From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."

languages.text: {n}索罗蒙开了口，洪亮的声音中满是谴责之意。{/n}“为什么法务部的人喜欢就地处决犯人，你们现在应该明白了吧。因为这些人只要活着，就一定会犯罪。从他们犯下异端恶行的那一刻起，他们就已经失去了继续做人的资格。他们唯一的结果，就是越陷越深。”
languages.original_text: {n}The Proctor's voice booms with denunciation:{/n} "Now you see why Arbitrators prefer to execute criminals immediately — because this is what they will do otherwise with the life they are offered. From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."

traits.locale_text: {n}索罗蒙开了口，洪亮的声音中满是谴责之意。{/n}“为什么法务部的人喜欢就地处决犯人，你们现在应该明白了吧。因为这些人只要活着，就一定会犯罪。从他们犯下异端恶行的那一刻起，他们就已经失去了继续做人的资格。他们唯一的结果，就是越陷越深。”

languages.text: {n}La voz del Procurador retumba con su veredicto:{/n} «Ahora ve por qué los Arbitrator preferimos ejecutar a los criminales de inmediato: porque esto es lo que hacen con la vida que se les ofrece. Desde el momento en el que caen en la herejía, pierden el derecho a considerarse humanos. A partir de entonces, solo pueden seguir hundiéndose en la ignominia».
languages.original_text: {n}The Proctor's voice booms with denunciation:{/n} "Now you see why Arbitrators prefer to execute criminals immediately — because this is what they will do otherwise with the life they are offered. From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."

traits.locale_text: {n}La voz del Procurador retumba con su veredicto:{/n} «Ahora ve por qué los Arbitrator preferimos ejecutar a los criminales de inmediato: porque esto es lo que hacen con la vida que se les ofrece. Desde el momento en el que caen en la herejía, pierden el derecho a considerarse humanos. A partir de entonces, solo pueden seguir hundiéndose en la ignominia».

languages.text: {n}La voix sentencieuse du proctor résonne près de vous :{/n} « Vous comprenez maintenant pourquoi les arbitrators préfèrent exécuter les criminels sans attendre : voilà ce qu'ils font de la vie qu'on leur offre. Dès l'instant où ils plongent dans l'hérésie, ils renoncent à leur humanité, sans espoir de salut. Ils sont condamnés à régresser. »
languages.original_text: {n}The Proctor's voice booms with denunciation:{/n} "Now you see why Arbitrators prefer to execute criminals immediately — because this is what they will do otherwise with the life they are offered. From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."

traits.locale_text: {n}La voix sentencieuse du proctor résonne près de vous :{/n} « Vous comprenez maintenant pourquoi les arbitrators préfèrent exécuter les criminels sans attendre : voilà ce qu'ils font de la vie qu'on leur offre. Dès l'instant où ils plongent dans l'hérésie, ils renoncent à leur humanité, sans espoir de salut. Ils sont condamnés à régresser. »

languages.text: {n}非難に満ちた代理人の声が轟いた。{/n}「今こそ分かったでしょう。なぜアービトレイターが犯罪者を即座に処刑することを好むのか。そうしなければ、彼らは与えられた命でこういうことをするからです。異端に堕ちた瞬間から、もはや人間と呼ばれる資格すらほぼなくなる。あとはただ堕ちていくだけです」
languages.original_text: {n}The Proctor's voice booms with denunciation:{/n} "Now you see why Arbitrators prefer to execute criminals immediately — because this is what they will do otherwise with the life they are offered. From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."

traits.locale_text: {n}非難に満ちた代理人の声が轟いた。{/n}「今こそ分かったでしょう。なぜアービトレイターが犯罪者を即座に処刑することを好むのか。そうしなければ、彼らは与えられた命でこういうことをするからです。異端に堕ちた瞬間から、もはや人間と呼ばれる資格すらほぼなくなる。あとはただ堕ちていくだけです」

languages.text: {n}Üsteğmen, kınayıcı bir ses tonuyla konuşuyor.{/n} "Yargıcıların neden suçluları hemen infaz ettiğini anladınız mı? Çünkü ellerindeki hayatla yaptıkları şey bu oluyor. Kâfirliğe teslim oldukları andan itibaren onlara insan demek bile zorlaşıyor. Tek yaptıkları, daha derine batmak oluyor."
languages.original_text: {n}The Proctor's voice booms with denunciation:{/n} "Now you see why Arbitrators prefer to execute criminals immediately — because this is what they will do otherwise with the life they are offered. From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."

traits.locale_text: {n}Üsteğmen kınayıcı bir ses tonuyla konuşuyor:{/n} "Yargıcıların neden suçluları hemen infaz ettiğini anladınız mı? Çünkü ellerindeki hayatla yaptıkları şey bu oluyor. Kâfirliğe teslim oldukları andan itibaren onlara insan demek bile zorlaşıyor. Tek yaptıkları daha derine batmak oluyor."

languages.text: {n}In der Stimme des Proktors liegt eine donnernde Anklage:{/n} "Jetzt seht Ihr, warum Arbitratoren Verbrechen lieber sofort hinrichten – weil diese sonst genau das mit dem Leben machen, das ihnen angeboten wird. Sobald sie der Ketzerei erliegen, haben sie eigentlich kein Recht mehr, Menschen genannt zu werden – ab dann können sie nur noch immer tiefer sinken."
languages.original_text: {n}The Proctor's voice booms with denunciation:{/n} "Now you see why Arbitrators prefer to execute criminals immediately — because this is what they will do otherwise with the life they are offered. From the moment they fall into heresy, they hardly have the right to be called human anymore — all they can do from then on is sink deeper."

Sobald sie der Ketzerei erliegen, haben sie eigentlich kein Recht mehr, Menschen genannt zu werden – ab dann können sie nur noch immer tiefer sinken."
